page.title: 14Watercress
page.content: The Mid-Hants Railway was opened in 1865, one of the 3 lines that have run through the village. Despite considerable opposition it was closed in 1972. It became known as the{Watercress {Line}because the line runs through the area of Hampshire famous for its Watercress beds. The collection of Watercress from King's Worthy station meant it could be swiftly delivered nationwide. The{Springvale watercress beds, 39 in all, are fed by natural spring water. Each bed is sown with 2.5lb of seed. From seed to cutting takes 5 weeks. It is fed with fertiliser-basic slag, which is made of iron filings which helps the cress to keep its colour. If sown too thick the cress goes 'hot' and is yellowish in colour.
